description.narrative:
Project Outcome: (i) Stakeholder Effects - Capital relief and increasing lending capacity of financial Institutions: The Project is expected to support offloading NPLs from financial institutions with an estimated OPB of US$875 million. This will help financial institutions relieve capital constraints and increase lending capacity. (ii) Stakeholder Effects-Normalization of distressed SME borrowers and distressed property developers. (iii) Environmental effects: Through the Project, IFC will convert the distressed Single Assets into green properties. This will lead to an expected reduction of GHG emission of up to 64,294 t CO2/yr.
Market Creation (i) Competitiveness: China's distressed asset market is still dominated by state-owned enterprises, with significant developmental gap between Tier-1 cities/coastal provinces and frontier provinces. IFC aims to promote market competition by strengthening the institutional capacity of capable domestic private sector players and to address the market gap by contributing to the improvement of legal infrastructure in frontier provinces and sharing distressed asset resolution experiences with court systems in those markets. (ii) Sustainability: The Project will be IFC's first green distressed asset investment project. IFC aims to promote greater sustainability through standard setting and market enabling by greening distressed Single Assets and promoting international green building standards to the market.

The proposed investment entails IFCs investment in a special purchase vehicle (DARP SPV) to be set up together with Dinghui Equity Investment Management (Tianjin) Limited Company, and/or its affiliate (collectively CDH), a leading alternative asset manager in China. The proposed investment will primarily focus on the investment and resolution of non-performing SME portfolios (NPL Portfolios), the investment, greening, and resolution of distressed properties (Single Assets) in China, and the development of distressed asset market in frontier regions of China.
